Descriptive Lists: Kepler-758 d is an exoplanet orbiting the star Kepler-758, located about 4899.6 light-years (1502.2 pc) away from Solar System. Its discovery was publicly announced on 2016.

The host star Kepler-758 has apparent magnitude of 13.4, with absolute magnitude of 2.5. It is 1.2 times more massive and 1.6 times bigger compared with our Sun. The surface temperature is 6360 with its spectral types of F8 
In this planetary system, the extrasolar planet Kepler-758 d orbits around the star Kepler-758 every 20.5 days  with its orbital distance of 0.15 AU ( 23039484.3 km) 


 (Projected orbit of Kepler-758 d around its host star Kepler-758)






The Star Kepler-758 's habitable zone is located at the following distance
Inner Boundary (the orbital distance at Venus's Equivalent Radiation )
 : 1.377 AU ( 205943708.4 km) 

Earth Boundary (the orbital distance at Earth's Equivalent Radiation)
 : 1.903 AU ( 284668024.6 km) 

Outer Boundary (the orbital distance at Mars's  Equivalent Radiation)
 : 2.900 AU ( 433771072.5 km) 

Snow Line      (the orbital distance at Snow Line Equivalent Radiation)
 : 4.267 AU ( 638313135.5 km) 

Radiation at Planetary Boundary of Kepler-758 d    : 208780.99 W/m2
